title: Have you ever banned a champion not because they are broken but because you hate fighting them?
body:
I normally ban zac and gangplank in ranked. I dont care how nerfed or whatever, a good GP or zac ruins your day.


But lately ive been banning Thresh just because i cant ever seem to outplay him or beat him. Especially when i play elise, i  feel like im cursed to always fight Thresh.

I dont know i just hate thresh.

If he isn't already banned by the time it is my turn, I ban him.  

I do not want him on my team or the enemy team.

Considering their Championship skins were just released, I'm expecting to see them in most games for the next week or two.

obvious reasons? if ur implying hes op, hes not wrong, if u just hate fighting him (as a semi yasuo main, I understand how infuriating fighting a good yasuo is) and the new skins... I want to use my new champ zed ;-;

The "obvious reasons" I was referring to the fact that I just don't like having him on my team or the enemy team, as previously stated.

Personally, I find him unfun to play against and I find Yasuo players rather inconsistent.  Not only does he attract a certain type of player (similar to Vayne, Zed or Riven), he can be rather difficult so many of them just feed horribly.

It just isn't worth taking the risk of an ally Yasuo feeding or an enemy Yasuo getting fed.
------------
If the enemy team gets Yasuo, I will typically just camp him.  I find they are very prone to raging in all-chat and tilting their entire team when they start doing poorly.

yeahhhhhh, I know, the yasuo stereotype, feelsbadman
yeah, a lot of other yasuo players are really inconsistent

That's my only reason for banning. and should be everyone's primary reason for banning. Balance is close enough that your own personal preferences and strengths/weaknesses are much more important. Except in rare cases, like when playing Poro King, where there are some very obviously broken champs

Technically, that's what bans are meant for. They remove champions you personally don't want to deal with, or that you know the enemy team is strong with in a tourney setting.

Unfortunately, LoL is far from a balanced game, so most bans are used just to get rid of champions that are too powerful.
